description: Expansion panels are used to show and hide content that may be less important or too large to display on screen all of the time. They can also be used to expand lists of items, e.g. Show more. The expansion panel consists of a button which, when clicked, toggles the open/closed state of the expansion panel and a slot for the content to display on expansion.

props.name: value
props.description: A boolean indicating whether or not the expansion panel is expanded.

props.name: label
props.description: The label of the expansion button

props.name: id
props.description:
Provide an id to support aria-controls. The id will be placed on the expansion panel content wrapper and the
aria-controls on the header (triggering the expansion).

props.name: icon
props.description: An icon to display to the left of the label

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the expansion button. This can be located above the content to expand or below it.

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the expansion panel button.

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the expansion panel button.

props.name: disabled
props.description: The disabled state of the expansion panel

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the expansion panel button is clicked.
